channel.title: How To Access Your Computer From Anywhere!
channel.description:
Hey! It's been a minute since I've been here, but I found this cool new trick and I just can't let people not know about it. This has so many possibilities it's unbelievable. I'm talking, controlling other's computers, using your computer from work or even school. The best part about using it from school? Well, it can't be blocked, and you don't need to download anything to use it, because you view your computer through a web browser! Now that your hopes are high, and your probably really excited lemme break some harsh news to you, I don't think people with routers can do it, sorry. but, if your router free, read on!
The process is done through something called VNC which stands for Virtual Network Computing. The idea is kind of like an R.A.T. like Sub 7 or one of those programs, but it's not a trojan. The program I use is [url=http://www.realvnc.com/products/free/4.1/download.html]RealVNC[/url]. Now enough with the explanations and let's get started!
1. After you download and install the program goto Start>RealVNC>VNC Server 4 (user mode)>Run VNC Server. 2. Goto the authentication tab and configure a password. 3. Your Set for now! As long as the server is running on your pc, you can access your computer from anywhere in the world! But, you probably want to check on how to do that, so here's the steps to run it. 4. From any computer with java installed in the web browser, goto [YOUR IP]:5800. 5. Don't get Caught!

item.title: How To Access Your Computer From Anywhere!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Upsides: none because it wont fucking work

It keeps saying connection reset by peer…

Re-installed and now it says timed out. Does anyone know another remote desktop app made in java? My school blocks exes…

Read full topic

item.title: How To Access Your Computer From Anywhere!
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Buzzy:

Well, sadly, I guess that my school blocked me from any port 5800. I’m going to try to make up a random port and try again, and I advise anyone with the same problem to also do this.

If they block outgoing 5800, change it to 80 or 443 or something. I’m assuming they just block traffic, and don’t actually check the data against a protocol whitelist or something.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Access Your Computer From Anywhere!

item.title: How To Access Your Computer From Anywhere!
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:10, topic:250351”][quote author=oxxo qb link=topic=330165.msg2583783#msg2583783 date=1229375552]
Use Hamachi ?

Or this that just a stupid anwser
[/quote]
Stupid answer?

Or, you could just install TSweb.

It comes with Windows (2003). All you do to install it is install IIS then go to control panel>add/remove programs>add/remove windows components.
Now just look around through it till you find TSweb.

Upsides:
Works from any computer which allows activex

Downsides:
Needs internet explorer.

RealVNC has a Java client…
Upsides:
Works on every platform, and every browser, doesn’t require ISS or a Windows server
Downsides:
None

School computers do not always have java.[/quote]

they dont always have windows

Read full topic

I'm talking, controlling other's computers, using your computer from work or even school. The best part about using it from school?
